tagging.summary_intro: The following resources were created but failed to receive workshop tags:
tagging.summary_fallback: These resources will rely on naming conventions for cleanup identification.

thing_types.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: Thing Types - Device Categories
thing_types.content:
AWS IoT Thing Types are templates that define categories of IoT devices using the CreateThingType API.
They act as blueprints specifying common attributes and behaviors for similar devices. The API
creates searchable attributes that enable AWS IoT Fleet Indexing queries and bulk operations on device categories.
Thing Types help organize your device fleet and enable scalable AWS IoT Device Management.
thing_types.next: We will create {} Thing Types using the AWS IoT CreateThingType API: {}

fleet_indexing.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: Fleet Indexing - Device Search & Query
fleet_indexing.content:
AWS IoT Fleet Indexing uses the UpdateIndexingConfiguration API to enable powerful search capabilities.
It indexes device registry data, connectivity status, and AWS IoT Device Shadows (including the special
$package shadow for firmware versions). The API configures indexing modes and shadow filters
to enable dynamic Thing Groups and fleet-wide queries for large-scale deployments.
fleet_indexing.next: We will enable Fleet Indexing with $package shadow support using UpdateIndexingConfiguration API

s3_storage.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: S3 Storage - Firmware Distribution
s3_storage.content:
Amazon S3 APIs (CreateBucket, PutBucketVersioning) provide secure, scalable firmware storage.
The CreateBucket API establishes the storage location while PutBucketVersioning enables
immutable firmware tracking. S3 integrates with AWS IoT Jobs through presigned URLs
generated via GetObject API for secure, credential-free firmware downloads.
s3_storage.next: We will create an S3 bucket in {} with versioning using S3 APIs

firmware_packages.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: Firmware Packages - Version Management
firmware_packages.content:
S3 PutObject API uploads firmware packages as ZIP files with unique version IDs.
Each upload generates immutable artifacts through S3 versioning. The HeadObject API
checks for existing files while PutObject creates new versions for precise
firmware lifecycle control and over-the-air update management.
firmware_packages.next: We will upload {} firmware packages ({} types Ã— {} versions)

package_catalog.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: Software Package Catalog - Centralized Management
package_catalog.content:
AWS IoT Software Package Catalog APIs (CreatePackage, CreatePackageVersion) provide centralized firmware management.
CreatePackage establishes the package while CreatePackageVersion links S3 artifacts to IoT packages.
The UpdatePackageVersion API publishes versions, enabling automated device shadow updates
when jobs complete successfully. This integration creates complete firmware lifecycle management.
package_catalog.next: We will create {} AWS IoT Software Package Catalog packages and publish all versions to the catalog

iam_roles.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: IAM Roles - Secure Access Control
iam_roles.content:
AWS Identity and Access Management APIs (CreateRole, PutRolePolicy) provide secure service credentials.
The CreateRole API establishes trust relationships while PutRolePolicy grants specific
permissions. IAM roles enable AWS IoT to generate presigned URLs for S3 firmware downloads
without exposing AWS credentials to devices, ensuring secure and scalable access control.
iam_roles.next: We will create IoTJobsRole and IoTPackageConfigRole using IAM APIs

package_configuration.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: Package Configuration - Automated Shadow Updates
package_configuration.content:
AWS IoT Software Package Catalog UpdatePackageConfiguration API enables automatic AWS IoT Device Shadow updates.
When devices report successful firmware installation via AWS IoT Jobs, AWS IoT Core automatically
updates the device's $package shadow with the new firmware version. This creates a reliable
audit trail and ensures device inventory reflects actual firmware state across your fleet.
package_configuration.next: We will enable global package configuration using UpdatePackageConfiguration API

device_creation.title: ğŸ“š LEARNING MOMENT: AWS IoT Things & Thing Groups - Device Fleet Creation
device_creation.content:
AWS IoT CreateThing and CreateThingGroup APIs establish your device fleet in the cloud.
CreateThing registers individual devices with attributes while CreateThingGroup provides
organizational structure. AddThingToThingGroup API creates relationships enabling
bulk operations and policy inheritance across your AWS IoT Device Management fleet.
device_creation.next: We will create {} Thing Groups and {} AWS IoT Things using AWS IoT APIs
